b'b" We found a bug while parsing the above url: url  Once again the problem reside on the header response. The first caracter on the header field shoud be an ascii between a to z

column10: b'b" This appears to be caused by this:    if (c < \'a\' || \'z\' < c) goto error; which rejects non-alphabetic first characters. The BNF for the field name in HTTP is \'token\' which accepts a much broader range of characters (see url "'

b"b' http_parser: assert that parser isnt a NULL pointer'"
b"b' Signed-off-by: Sid Heroor heroor@'"
b"b' Sorry
column11: but what is the point of assert? It will crash on that line anyway
column12: either with define or without it.'"

column10: b'b" I wasn\'t sure whether to assert or to just return if the pointer is NULL. There is no way for the caller to know if init succeeded either. Atleast with an assert it\'s pretty clear that it was a NULL pointer. "'
b'b" Well
column11: this is kind of obvious stuff. You should not ever pass NULL pointer to it
column12: so there should be no check in it. If you have passed the NULL as the pointer it is a terrible error and a fatal condition. Crashing on it is totally reasonable. Sorry
column14: I don\'t think that it is worth adding an assert here. Thank you for posting a PR

b"b' @leakim is there a way I can add null termination to  '"
b"b' @leakim I used: But I am still getting a Access Violation Exception. If you have any code that uses the parser can you post an excerpt of it?'"
b'b" Your example code is still not running memset on the http_parser_settings structure. In your code
column11: you are running memset on recvbuf (which doesn\'t need it)
column12: instead of running it on the http_parser_settings structure.In addition
column14: you are overwriting all of the data that the recv() call returned
column15: which seems unlikely to be what you want."'
